attributes.magic: ELF 32-bit MSB executable, MIPS, MIPS-I version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, no section header

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects a suspicious ELF binary with UPX compression
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: This is a MIPS variant of the Mozi P2P botnet. The sample propagates by exploiting numerous known command injection vulnerabilities in IoT devices (e.g., GPON, Huawei, D-Link). It downloads and executes further payloads, as indicated by strings like `/Mozi.m;chmod+777+Mozi.7;/tmp/Mo`. The malware establishes persistence by modifying startup scripts (`/etc/rc.local`) and remounting the filesystem as read-write (`mount -o remount,rw /overlay /`). It also manipulates iptables to allow its network traffic and terminates competing processes.
